bill.title: Qualified equity investment credits; increase amount that may be allocated by MDA in a fiscal year increase time period for issuance.
bill.description: An Act To Amend Section 57-105-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Credit Allowance Date For The Income Tax And Insurance Premium Tax Credits For Taxpayers Holding Certain Qualified Investments; To Include Within The Definition Of The Term "qualified Low-income Community Investment" Certain Capital Or Equity Investments Or Loans If The Proceeds Of Such Investment Can Be Directly Traced To A Qualified Active Low-income Business; To Authorize The Mississippi Development Authority To Exceed The Maximum Amount Of Qualified Low-income Community Investments Issued To A Single Qualified Active Low-income Community Business If It Is Determined That The Qualified Active Low-income Business Is Separate And Distinct; To Increase From $15,000,000.00 To $20,000,000.00 The Maximum Aggregate Amount Of Qualified Equity Investments That May Be Allocated By The Mississippi Development Authority In Any One State Fiscal Year; To Require Qualified Community Development Entities To Make Certain Additional Certifications To The Mississippi Development Authority; To Increase From 60 To 90 Days The Period Of Time After The Mississippi Development Authority Has Allocated Such Credits To A Qualified Community Development Entity That The Corresponding Qualified Low-income Community Investment Must Be Issued; To Include Municipal Airport Authorities Within The Definition Of The Term "public Entity;" And For Related Purposes.
